body:
Possibly related to #4415 

Since 0.10.1 - and just confirmed with 0.11.0 - containers from pods do not have any Kubernetes related env vars set.

```
$ vagrant ssh node-01
CoreOS alpha (593.0.0)
Update Strategy: No Reboots
core@node-01 ~ $ docker ps
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE                        COMMAND                CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES
0522aeebbdda        pires/elasticsearch:master   "/usr/bin/runsvdir -   47 minutes ago      Up 47 minutes                           k8s_elasticsearch-master.6d831f7e_elasticsearch-master-fplln.default.etcd_f40cf7be-b848-11e4-895a-080027aeee49_a251d366
823d55b2770c        kubernetes/pause:go          "/pause"               58 minutes ago      Up 58 minutes                           k8s_POD.8f3eed67_elasticsearch-master-fplln.default.etcd_f40cf7be-b848-11e4-895a-080027aeee49_017ece96
core@node-01 ~ $ docker exec 0522aeebbdda env
PATH=/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin
HOSTNAME=elasticsearch-master-fplln
HOME=/root
JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-8-oracle
ES_PKG_NAME=elasticsearch-1.4.2
```

@sub-mod is facing the same issue and we both can confirm that 0.9.x works well.

title: Pod containers with no environment variables set
